node.statement:
(Uniform integrability of exp(Psi_eps^{ren}) under the Skorokhod coupling) On the Skorokhod space (Omega, F, P) from node 1.6.3.2, define Y_eps(omega) := exp(Psi_eps^{ren}(Phi_eps(omega))) and Y(omega) := exp(Psi^{ren}(Phi(omega))).

CLAIM: The family {Y_eps}_{eps > 0} is uniformly integrable on (Omega, F, P).

PROOF: By Vitali's criterion, it suffices to show that sup_{eps} E_P[Y_eps^{1+delta}] < infinity for some delta > 0. We have:

E_P[Y_eps^{1+delta}] = E_P[exp((1+delta) Psi_eps^{ren}(Phi_eps))]
= E_{mu_eps}[exp((1+delta) Psi_eps^{ren})]   (since law(Phi_eps) = mu_eps under P).

Now, (1+delta) Psi_eps^{ren} = sum_{j=1}^4 (1+delta) c_j <f_j, :phi_eps^{k_j}:_{C_eps}> where the terms and coefficients are as in node 1.5.1. By Holder's inequality with exponents (4,4,4,4):

E_{mu_eps}[exp((1+delta) Psi_eps^{ren})] <= prod_{j=1}^4 (E_{mu_eps}[exp(4(1+delta) c_j <f_j, :phi_eps^{k_j}:_{C_eps}>)])^{1/4}.

For each j, the exponential moment E_{mu_eps}[exp(alpha <f_j, :phi_eps^{k_j}:>)] is bounded uniformly in eps by node 1.6.2.10.2.4 (validated): for any alpha in R and k in {1,2,3}, there exists M(alpha, f, k) independent of eps such that E_{mu_eps}[exp(alpha <f, :phi_eps^k:>)] <= M(alpha, f, k). Taking alpha = 4(1+delta) c_j and f = f_j, k = k_j:

E_{mu_eps}[exp(4(1+delta) c_j <f_j, :phi_eps^{k_j}:>)] <= M(4(1+delta) c_j, f_j, k_j) < infinity, uniformly in eps.

Therefore: sup_{eps} E_P[Y_eps^{1+delta}] <= prod_{j=1}^4 M(4(1+delta) c_j, f_j, k_j)^{1/4} < infinity.

CONCLUSION: {Y_eps} is uniformly integrable on (Omega, P), for ANY delta > 0 (i.e., we actually have uniform L^p(P) bounds for ALL p >= 1).

CRITICAL DISTINCTION: This uniform integrability is for {exp(Psi_eps^{ren})} under the FIXED measure P on the Skorokhod space. This is NOT the same as uniform integrability of {R_eps = exp(Psi_eps^{ren} + L_eps + K_eps)} under the CHANGING measures {mu_eps}. The latter is blocked (as noted in the parent node). The former works because Psi_eps^{ren} does not include the divergent L_eps term, and the exponential integrability of individual Wick power pairings (node 1.6.2.10.2.4) provides the needed uniform moment bounds.

DEPENDENCIES: Nodes 1.6.2.10.2.4 (uniform exponential bounds under mu_eps), 1.5.1 (decomposition of Psi^{ren} into terms), 1.6.3.2 (Skorokhod coupling).
